## {{< fa info-circle >}} Session Overview

Explore governance models and best practices for open source projects, with a focus on creating inclusive and sustainable communities. This session introduces practical frameworks like Martha's Rules, covers meeting management techniques, and provides hands-on activities to assess and improve your project's governance structure.

## {{< fa bullseye >}} Learning Objectives

By the end of this session, you will be able to:

- Understand different governance models for open source projects
- Apply Martha's Rules for effective decision-making
- Implement the 10 rules for better meetings
- Create clear roles and responsibilities matrices
- Establish and enforce codes of conduct
- Assess your project's current governance gaps

## {{< fa book >}} Resources

### Books & Publications

- **[Producing Open Source Software](https://producingoss.com)** by Karl Fogel - Comprehensive guide to running open source projects
- **[Research Software Engineering with Python](https://merely-useful.tech/py-rse/)** by Irving et al. - Includes governance practices for research software
- **[The Mythical Man-Month](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mythical_Man-Month)** by Brooks (1995) - Classic on software project management
- **[The Discussion Book](https://www.wiley.com/en-us/The+Discussion+Book%3A+50+Great+Ways+to+Get+People+Talking-p-9781119049715)** by Brookfield & Preskill (2016) - Techniques for managing discussions

### Articles & Essays

- **[The Tyranny of Structurelessness](https://www.jofreeman.com/joreen/tyranny.htm)** by Jo Freeman (1972) - Why informal structures can be problematic
- **[How to Respond to Code of Conduct Reports](https://files.frameshiftconsulting.com/books/cocguide.pdf)** by Aurora & Gardiner (2019) - Enforcement guide

### Websites & Tools

- **[Ask a Manager](https://www.askamanager.org/)** - Practical management advice
- **[Community Rule](https://communityrule.info/)** - Governance toolkit with multiple models
- **[NOAA Disruptive Behavior](https://coast.noaa.gov/ddb/)** - Guide for managing difficult participants
- **[Contributor Covenant](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/)** - Standard code of conduct template

### Research Papers

- **Majumder et al. (2019)** - "Why Software Projects Need Heroes: Lessons Learned from 1100+ Projects" - Analysis of hero programmers in GitHub projects
- **Petre & Wilson (2014)** - "Code Review for and by Scientists" - Study on code review effectiveness in scientific software development
